Ekonomi RI Cuma Tumbuh 5,02%, Pengusaha: Sudah Diperkirakan
05 Nov 2019, 06:07 by Trio Hamdani


Ketua Umum Kamar Dagang dan Industri (Kadin) Indonesia Rosan P. Roeslani/Foto: Grandyos Zafna

Jakarta - Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) mencatat pertumbuhan ekonomi Indonesia di kuartal III-2019 sebesar 5,02%. Sementara akumulasi dari kuartal I-2019, ekonomi Indonesia tercatat tumbuh 5,04%. Itu masih jauh dari proyeksi pemerintah sebesar 5,2% hingga akhir tahun.Melihat kondisi yang ada, pengusaha pesimistis pertumbuhan ekonomi nasional hingga akhir tahun menyentuh 5,1% ke atas. Paling mentok hanya di kisaran 5%. Artinya jauh di bawah yang diperkirakan pemerintah sebelumnya."Kalau pengusaha sih sudah memperkirakan. As predicted lah kita bilangnya. Dan kita juga melihat ya tahun ini pertumbuhan paling 5 koma 0 something lah," kata Ketua Umum Kamar Dagang dan Industri (Kadin) Indonesia Rosan P. Roeslani di Hotel Indonesia Kempinski, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Dia memahami bahwa kondisi perekonomian dunia saat ini sedang tidak begitu baik, terbukti dari sejumlah lembaga internasional yang memangkas prediksi pertumbuhan ekonomi dunia dan negara-negara lain."Kita lihat memang perlambatan pertumbuhan dunia, semua negara dikoreksi, pertumbuhan dunia dikoreksi baik oleh IMF, World Bank, semua lakukan koreksi," sebutnya.Kondisi yang ada di dunia tentunya akan berpengaruh ke Indonesia juga, yang mana dampaknya terlihat dari akselerasi pertumbuhan ekonomi yang cuma di kisaran 5% hingga kuartal III-2019."Otomatis ya pasti ada dampaknya ke kita," ungkap Rosan.Namun dia menambahkan bahwa dampak pelemahan ekonomi dunia terhadap Indonesia tidak begitu signifikan seperti negara lain. Itu karena Indonesia belum menjadi bagian dari rantai pasok perdagangan dunia. Simak Video "Sandi: Pemerintah Terjebak Dalam Pertumbuhan Ekonomi 5%"[Gambas:Video 20detik](toy/ara)

RI's Economy Has Only Gone 5.02%, Entrepreneurs: Predicted
05 Nov 2019, 06:07 by Trio Hamdani


Chairperson of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin) Rosan P. Roeslani / Photo: Grandyos Zafna

Jakarta - The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) recorded Indonesia's economic growth in the third quarter of 2019 of 5.02%. While accumulated from the first quarter of 2019, Indonesia's economy recorded a growth of 5.04%. That is still far from the government's projection of 5.2% until the end of the year. Looking at the existing conditions, entrepreneurs are pessimistic that national economic growth until the end of the year touches 5.1% and above. Most stuck only in the range of 5%. The meaning is far below what the previous government had predicted. "If the entrepreneurs have predicted it. As predicted, we say it. And we also see that this year the growth is at most 5 point something," said Chair of the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry (Kadin) Rosan P. Roeslani at Hotel Indonesia Kempinski, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). He understands that the condition of the world economy is currently not so good, as evidenced by a number of international institutions that cut predictions of world economic growth and other countries. " We see indeed slowing world growth, all countries are corrected, world growth is corrected both by the IMF, the World Bank, all make corrections, "he said. Conditions in the world will certainly affect Indonesia as well, where the impact seen from accelerated economic growth is only in the range of 5% until the third quarter of 2019. "Automatically yes there must be an impact on us," said Rosan. But he added that the impact of weakening oak the world economy towards Indonesia is not as significant as other countries.
